page.title: 18HUTTON MARR SCHOOL CLOSURE
page.content:
This school is closing on the 17th of July, 1985. Despite efforts of parents, governors and members of the community, assisted by others who had conducted similar campaigns, even to the extent of Hutton's sending a delegation to Westminster to put our case to the Secretary of State, the decision to close the school was announced this spring.
Reasons given are economical - that in order to comply with government restrictions on expenditure, the L.E.A. must take out of operation a certain number of unused school places; and educational - that schools of Hutton Marr's size do not provide sufficient opportunities for their children. {Time will tell as to {whether or not the decision was the {best one in all respects.}
